intro: Euphrasia officinalis subsp. hirtella, commonly known as hairy eyebright, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its upright stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy leaves and stems, which give it its common name. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats.
